gurmukhi: ਜੇ ਤਜਿ ਭਜੇ ਹੁਤੇ ਗੁਰ ਅਾਨਾ || ਤਿਨ ਪੁਨਿ ਗੁਰੂ ਅਹਦੀਅਹਿ ਜਾਨਾ ||
transliteration: Je Taj(i) Bhaje Houte Gur Aanaa|| Tin Poun(i) Guroo Ahdooah(i) Jaanaa||
translation: Those who had fled form Anandpur forsaking the refuge of the Guru and considered are officers as their Guru.

gurmukhi: ਮੂਤ੍ਰ ਡਾਰ ਤਿਨ ਸੀਸ ਮੁੰਡਾੲੇ || ਪਾਹੁਰਿ ਜਾਨਿ ਗ੍ਹਿਹਿ ਲੈ ਅਾੲੇ ||੧੮||
transliteration: Moondra Daar Tin Soos Mounndaae|| Paahur(i) Jaan(i) Grihah(i) Lai Aae||18||
translation: Who have put the urine on their heads and shaved them, it appears that they Guru, these officers enquired about their address from others.18.

gurmukhi: ਜੇ ਜੇ ਭਾਜ ਹੁਤੇ ਬਿਨੁ ਅਾੲਿਸੁ || ਕਹੋ ਅਹਦੀਅਹਿ ਕਿਨੈ ਬਤਾੲਿਸੁ ||
transliteration: Je Je Bhaaj Houte Bin(u) Aais(u)|| Kaho Ahdooah(i) Kinai Bataais(u)||
translation: Those who had fled from Anandpur without the permission of their Guru, these officers enquired about their address from others.

gurmukhi: ਮੂੰਡ ਮੂੰਡਿ ਕਰਿ ਸਹਿਰ ਫਿਰਾੲੇ || ਕਾਰ ਭੇਟ ਜਨੁ ਲੈਨ ਸਿਧਾੲੇ ||੧੯||
transliteration: Moondd Moondd(i) Kar(i) Sahir Phiraae|| Kaar Bhet Jan(u) Lain Sidhaae||19||
translation: They have got their heads shaved and caused them to move throughout the city. It appears that they have been sent to collect the offerings by the officers.19.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਛੇ ਲਾਗਿ ਲਰਿਕਵਾ ਚਲੇ || ਜਾਨੁਕ ਸਿੱਖ ਸਖਾ ਹੈਂ ਭਲੇ ||
transliteration: Paachhe Laag(i) Larikavaa Chale|| Jaanak Sikkh Sakhaa Hain Bhale||
translation: The boys who are following them and jeering them, appear like their disciples and servants.

gurmukhi: ਛਿੱਕੇ ਤੋਬਰਾ ਬਦਨ ਚੜਾੲੇ || ਜਨੁ ਗ੍ਹਿ ਖਾਨ ਮਲੀਦਾ ਅਾੲੇ ||੨੦||
transliteration: Chhikke Tobraa Badan Chadhaae|| Jan(u) Grih Khaan Maloodaa Aae||20||
translation: The nose-bags containing turd of the horses, tied on their faces make them appear to have received for eating the sweetmeat from their homes.20.

gurmukhi: ਮਸਤਕ ਸੁਭੇ ਪਨਹੀਯਨ ਘਾੲਿ || ਜਨੁ ਕਰਿ ਟੀਕਾ ਦੲੇ ਬਨਾੲਿ ||
transliteration: Mastak Soubhe Panhooyan Ghaae|| Jan(u) Kar(i) Tookaa Dae Banaae||
translation: The marks of the wounds on their foreheads, cussed by the beating with shoes, look like the frontal marks put by the officers (as Guru).

gurmukhi: ਸੀਸ ੲੀਟ ਕੇ ਘਾੲਿ ਕਰੇਹੀ || ਜਨੁ ਤਿਨੁ ਭੇਟ ਪੁਰਾਤਨ ਦੇਹੀ ||੨੧||
transliteration: Soos Oot Ke Ghaae Darehoo|| Jan(u) Tin(u) Bhet Puraatan Dehoo||21||
translation: The wounds on heads caused by the brick-hittings, appear like the previous offering given to them.21.

gurmukhi: ਕਬਹੂੰ ਰਣ ਜੂਝਿਓ ਨਹੀ ਕਛੁ ਦੈ ਜਸੁ ਨਹਿ ਲੀਨ ||
transliteration: Kab-hoon Ran Joojhio Nahoo Kachh(u) Dai Jas(u) Nah(i) Loon||
translation: Those who have never participated in the war in the battlefield and also have not earned approbation by offering bride.

gurmukhi: ਗਾਂਵ ਬਸਤ ਜਾਨਿਯੋ ਨਹੀ ਜਮ ਸੋ ਕਿਨ ਕਹਿ ਦੀਨ ||੨੨||
transliteration: Gadnv Basat Jaaniyo Nahoo Jam So Kin Kah(i) Doon||22||
translation: Who are not known by anybody as the residents of the village, it is, indeed, wonderful as to who hath given their address to Yama (the god of death)?22.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਹ ਬਿਧਿ ਤਿਨੋ ਭਯੋ ੳੁਪਹਾਸਾ || ਸਭ ਸੰਤਨ ਮਿਲਿ ਲਖਿਓ ਤਮਾਸਾ ||
transliteration: Ih Bidh(i) Tino Bhayo Oup-haasaa|| Sabh Santan Mil(i) Lakhio Tamaasaa||
translation: In this way, the apostates received foul treatment. All the saints saw this spectacle.

gurmukhi: ਸੰਤਨ ਕਸਟ ਨ ਦੇਖਨ ਪਾਯੋ || ਅਾਪ ਹਾਥ ਦੈ ਨਾਥ ਬਚਾਯੋ ||੨੩||
transliteration: Santan Kast Na Dekhan Paayo|| Aap Haath Dai Naath Bachadyo||23||
translation: No harm was done to them, the Lord saved them Himself.23.
